Specific Details: It is proposed to exclude community employment participants from working in childcare if they do not have their  FETAC Level 5 Certificate.  We are a Community based childcare facility and value the contribution of our CE participants who all commence their training on starting placement with us. This placement benefits the CE participants as they gain valuable hands on work experience which enhances their training and knowledge of childcare.
DPOs Lobbied: Cathy Bennett|Councillor|Monaghan County Council::Seamus Coyle|Councillor|Monaghan County Council::Ciara McPhillips|Councillor|Monaghan County Council::Seán Conlan|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Jackie Crowe|Councillor|Monaghan County Council::Joan Burton|Tánaiste and Minister|Department of Social Protection
Subject Matter: It is proposed to exclude community employment participants from working in childcare if they do not have their  FETAC Level 5 Certificate.  We are a Community based childcare facility and value the contribution of our CE participants who all commence their training on starting placement with us. This placement benefits the CE participants as they gain valuable hands on work experience which enhances their training and knowledge of childcare.
Intended Results: We want the proposed amendment to be withdrawn and the practice of allowing CE childcare participants who are in training for their Fetac Level 5 be included in the child/adult ratios or at least that they are deemed to be a second or third person in the room.  At all times CE participants will be supervised by qualified staff.
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Laura Ward, Manager Ballybay Community Creche Ltd

DPOs Lobbied: Cathy Bennett|Councillor|Monaghan County Council::Darcy Lonergan|Councillor|Dublin City Council
Intended Results: To inform of NWC research Women Beyond the Dail - Access, Representation and Retention of Women in Irish Local Government
Lobbying Activities:
NWC Women Beyond the Dail webinar - Clr Cathy Bennett and former Clr Darcy Lonergan spoke at the webinar on the experience of women in local government on 10/09/24.
NWC Women Beyond the Dail regional launch Cork City Council - Clr Laura Harmon spoke at the event on the experience of women in local government on 20/11/24.|Event / Reception|2-5
